templates.template: Zabbix LibreHardwareMonitor For WIndows Agent Lenovo
templates.name: Zabbix LibreHardwareMonitor For WIndows Agent Lenovo
templates.description: Template containing items for collecting data from LibreHardwareMonitor which needs to be installed and running on the windows machine with an active zabbix agent2.

items.name: WMI Battery Charge/Discharge Current
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE Name='Charge/Discharge Current'"]
items.description: Charge/Discharge Current: This measures the current going into the battery (charging) or coming out of it (discharging). A value of 0.000 A indicates that the battery is neither charging nor discharging at the time of measurement.

items.name: WMI Battery Charge/Discharge Rate
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE Name='Charge/Discharge Rate'"]
items.description: Charge/Discharge Rate: Represents the power involved in charging or discharging the battery. A value of 0.0 W corresponds to the battery being at rest (neither charging nor discharging).

items.name: WMI Battery Charge Level
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE Name='Charge Level'"]
items.description: Charge Level: Shows the percentage of the battery's capacity that is currently charged. A charge level of 99.0% means the battery is nearly fully charged.

triggers.expression: last(/Zabbix LibreHardwareMonitor For WIndows Agent Lenovo/wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE Name='Charge Level'"],#1)<10
triggers.recovery_expression: last(/Zabbix LibreHardwareMonitor For WIndows Agent Lenovo/wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE Name='Charge Level'"],#2)>=20
triggers.name: Battery Level Low
triggers.description: Sends Alert when device battery is below 10%

items.name: WMI Battery Charge Degradation Level
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE Name='Degradation Level'"]
items.description: Degradation Level: Indicates the percentage of the battery's capacity that has been lost due to aging and use compared to its original design. A degradation level of 6.9% means the battery has lost 6.9% of its original capacity.

triggers.expression: last(/Zabbix LibreHardwareMonitor For WIndows Agent Lenovo/wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE Name='Degradation Level'"],#3)>=75
triggers.recovery_expression: last(/Zabbix LibreHardwareMonitor For WIndows Agent Lenovo/wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE Name='Degradation Level'"],#3)<70
triggers.name: Batter Degradation Level at Critical Levels

items.name: WMI Battery Designed Capacity
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE Name='Designed Capacity'"]
items.description: Designed Capacity: The original total energy capacity of the battery as designed by the manufacturer, measured in milliwatt-hours (mWh).

items.name: WMI Battery Full Charged Capacity
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE Name='Full Charged Capacity'"]
items.description: Full Charged Capacity: The maximum energy the battery can hold when fully charged, accounting for the current battery health and degradation. It is typically less than the designed capacity due to wear and aging.

items.name: WMI Battery Remaining Capacity
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE Name='Remaining Capacity'"]
items.description: Remaining Capacity: The amount of energy currently stored in the battery.

items.name: WMI Battery Voltage
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE Name='Voltage'"]
items.description: Voltage: The voltage level of the battery. It shows the electric potential across the battery terminals. The given values suggest a consistent voltage, indicating stable battery condition when not under load or charging/discharging.

items.name: WMI Data NVIDIA GeForce RTX 300 Ti Laptop GPU D3D Dedicated Memory Used
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE Parent='/gpu-nvidia/0' AND Name='D3D Dedicated Memory Used'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Data of NVIDIA GPU D3D Dedicated Memory Used in MB.

items.name: WMI Data NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti Laptop GPU D3D Shared Memory Used
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE Parent='/gpu-nvidia/0' AND Name='D3D Shared Memory Used'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Data of NVIDIA GPU D3D Shared Memory Used in MB.

items.name: WMI Data NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti Laptop GPU Memory Free
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE Parent='/gpu-nvidia/0' AND Name='GPU Memory Free'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Data of NVIDIA GPU Memmory Free in MB.

items.name: WMI Data NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti Laptop GPU Memory Used
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE Parent='/gpu-nvidia/0' AND Name='GPU Memory Used'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Data of NVIDIA GPU Memmory Used in MB.

items.name: WMI Clock Bus Speed
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' AND name='Bus Speed'"]
items.description: Bus Speed: The speed of the front-side bus, which connects the CPU to the main memory.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H  Core #1 Clock Speed
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' and Name='Core #1'"]
items.description: Core #X: Operating frequency of each CPU core, which can scale up or down based on workload.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H  Core #2 Clock Speed
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' and Name='Core #2'"]
items.description: Core #X: Operating frequency of each CPU core, which can scale up or down based on workload.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H  Core #3 Clock Speed
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' and Name='Core #3'"]
items.description: Core #X: Operating frequency of each CPU core, which can scale up or down based on workload.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H  Core #4 Clock Speed
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' and Name='Core #4'"]
items.description: Core #X: Operating frequency of each CPU core, which can scale up or down based on workload.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H  Core #5 Clock Speed
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' and Name='Core #5'"]

items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' and Name='Core #6'"]

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H  Core #7 Clock Speed
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' and Name='Core #7'"]
items.description: Core #X: Operating frequency of each CPU core, which can scale up or down based on workload.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H  Core #8 Clock Speed
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' and Name='Core #8'"]
items.description: Core #X: Operating frequency of each CPU core, which can scale up or down based on workload.

items.name: WMI Clocks NVIDIA GPU Core
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' AND name='GPU Core'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for Clock speed of GPU Core in MHz.

items.name: WMI Clocks NVIDIA GPU Memory
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Clock' AND name='GPU Memory'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for Clock speed of GPU Memory in MHz.

items.name: WMI Data Memory Available
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Data' AND name='Memory Available'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for Data Memory Available in GB.

items.name: WMI Data Memory Used
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Data' AND name='Memory Used'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for Data Memory Used in GB.

items.name: WMI Data Virtual Memory Available
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Data' AND name='Virtual Memory Available'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for Data Virtual Memory Available in GB.

items.name: WMI Data Virtual Memory Used
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Data' AND name='Virtual Memory Used'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for Data Virtual Memory Used in GB.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H Factors Core #1
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value From Sensor Where SensorType='Factor' and name='Core #1'"]
items.description:
The "Factors" section in your hardware monitoring data likely refers to a multiplier used to determine the actual operating frequency of each CPU core. The figures given (e.g., 21.167, 45.750, 47.500) are typically multipliers that, when applied to the base clock speed (bus speed), give the effective frequency of each core.

Example:

    Base Clock Speed: Let’s say it's 100 MHz (common base for simplification).
    Multiplier (Factor): For Core #1, if it's 47.500,
    Effective Frequency: 100 MHz × 47.500 = 4750 MHz or 4.75 GHz

This multiplier changes dynamically based on workload demands to adjust the processor's speed within its power, thermal, and performance limits. It's part of what's known as "dynamic frequency scaling" or "CPU throttling," where the processor adjusts its speed to optimize performance and energy usage.

The data you provided for each core likely shows a range of multipliers that the processor has applied over a given period or under specific conditions:

    The first value (e.g., 21.167) might be the minimum multiplier used when the demand is low.
    The middle value (e.g., 45.750 or 46.000) might be a typical operational multiplier under normal to high load.
    The last value (47.500) could be the maximum multiplier, possibly under conditions of maximum performance demand or turbo boost.

items.name: WMI Load CPU Core Max
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='CPU Core Max'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor on Load for CPU Core Max in %.

items.name: WMI Load CPU Total
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='CPU Total'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor on CPU Load Total in %.

items.name: WMI Load NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti Laptop GPU D3D 3D
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D 3D' and Index='4'"]
items.description: D3D 3D, D3D Copy, D3D Overlay, D3D Security, etc.: These show how much of the GPU's capacity is being used for various Direct3D operations. These can include rendering 3D graphics, copying data between textures or buffers, handling secure content, and more. Low or zero values indicate these functions are not currently in use.

items.name: WMI Load AMD Radeon(TM) Graphics D3D Compute 0
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D Compute 0'"]
items.description: D3D Compute 0, 1, 3: Compute shaders are used for performing non-graphics computation (like physics or AI computations in games). The percentages here indicate how much of the GPU's computing capacity is used.

items.name: WMI Load AMD Radeon(TM) Graphics D3D Compute 1
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D Compute 1'"]
items.description: D3D Compute 0, 1, 3: Compute shaders are used for performing non-graphics computation (like physics or AI computations in games). The percentages here indicate how much of the GPU's computing capacity is used.

items.name: WMI Load AMD Radeon(TM) Graphics D3D Compute 3
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D Compute 3'"]
items.description: D3D Compute 0, 1, 3: Compute shaders are used for performing non-graphics computation (like physics or AI computations in games). The percentages here indicate how much of the compute capacity of the GPU is used.

items.name: WMI Load NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti Laptop GPU D3D COPY Engine
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D Copy' and Index='5'"]
items.description: D3D 3D, D3D Copy, D3D Overlay, D3D Security, etc.: These show how much of the GPU's capacity is being used for various Direct3D operations. These can include rendering 3D graphics, copying data between textures or buffers, handling secure content, and more. Low or zero values indicate these functions are not currently in use.

These can include rendering 3D graphics, copying data between textures or buffers, handling secure content, and more. Low or zero values indicate these functions are not currently in use.

items.name: WMI Load NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti Laptop GPU D3D Overlay
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D Overlay' and Parent='/gpu-nvidia/0'"]
items.description: D3D 3D, D3D Copy, D3D Overlay, D3D Security, etc.: These show how much of the GPU's capacity is being used for various Direct3D operations. These can include rendering 3D graphics, copying data between textures or buffers, handling secure content, and more. Low or zero values indicate these functions are not currently in use.

items.name: WMI Load NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti Laptop GPU D3D Security
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D Security' and Parent='/gpu-nvidia/0'"]
items.description: D3D 3D, D3D Copy, D3D Overlay, D3D Security, etc.: These show how much of the GPU's capacity is being used for various Direct3D operations. These can include rendering 3D graphics, copying data between textures or buffers, handling secure content, and more. Low or zero values indicate these functions are not currently in use.

items.name: WMI Load NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti Laptop GPU D3D Video Decode
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D Video Decode' and Parent='/gpu-nvidia/0'"]
items.description: D3D 3D, D3D Copy, D3D Overlay, D3D Security, etc.: These show how much of the GPU's capacity is being used for various Direct3D operations. These can include rendering 3D graphics, copying data between textures or buffers, handling secure content, and more. Low or zero values indicate these functions are not currently in use.

items.name: WMI Load NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti Laptop GPU D3D Video Encode
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D Video Encode' and Parent='/gpu-nvidia/0'"]
items.description: D3D 3D, D3D Copy, D3D Overlay, D3D Security, etc.: These show how much of the GPU's capacity is being used for various Direct3D operations. These can include rendering 3D graphics, copying data between textures or buffers, handling secure content, and more. Low or zero values indicate these functions are not currently in use.

items.name: WMI Load NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti Laptop GPU D3D Video Processing
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D Video Processing' and Index='11'"]
items.description: D3D Video Processing: This load indicates the utilization of the GPU for video processing tasks other than decoding and encoding. This could include color conversion, scaling, or other post-processing effects applied to video before it is displayed or further processed.

items.name: WMI Load NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti Laptop GPU D3D VR
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='D3D VR' and Parent='/gpu-nvidia/0'"]
items.description:
Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Load of NVIDIA GPU  D3D Video Decode in %.

D3D VR: Stands for the load related to Virtual Reality (VR) applications. If VR content is being rendered, this would show how much of the GPU's resources are dedicated to that task.

items.name: WMI Load NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti Laptop GPU Bus
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='GPU Bus' and Parent='/gpu-nvidia/0'"]
items.description: GPU Bus: Usage of the bus interface (typically PCIe) by the GPU, indicating the level of data transfer activity between the GPU and the rest of the system.

items.name: WMI Load NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti Laptop GPU Core
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='GPU Core'"]
items.description: GPU Core: The percentage of the GPU core's processing capacity currently being used. Higher percentages indicate more intense graphical processing.

items.name: WMI Load NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti Laptop GPU Memory
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='GPU Memory'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Load of GPU Memory in %.

items.name: WMI Load NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti Laptop GPU Memory Controller
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='GPU Memory Controller'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for the Load of GPU Memory Controller in %.

items.name: WMI Load NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti Laptop GPU Video Engine
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='GPU Video Engine'"]
items.description: GPU Video Engine: Utilization of the dedicated hardware for video encoding and decoding. Low usage here suggests minimal video processing activities.

items.name: WMI Load Memory
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='Memory'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for Memory Load in %.

items.name: WMI Load Virtual Memory
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' AND name='Virtual Memory'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for Virtual Memory Load in %.

items.name: WMI Load AMD Radeon(TM) Graphics D3D 3D
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' and Parent='/gpu-amd/0' and Name='D3D 3D'"]
items.description: D3D 3D: The percentage of the GPU's 3D engine utilized for rendering 3D graphics. This typically increases with graphically intensive applications like games or 3D modeling software.

items.name: WMI Load AMD Radeon(TM) Graphics D3D Copy
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' and Parent='/gpu-amd/0' and Name='D3D Copy'"]
items.description: D3D Copy: Utilization percentage of the GPU's ability to handle copy operations, such as texture or buffer transfers, which are crucial for graphics rendering.

items.name: WMI Load AMD Radeon(TM) Graphics D3D High Priority 3D
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' and Parent='/gpu-amd/0' and Name='D3D High Priority 3D'"]
items.description: D3D High Priority 3D/Compute: These are similar to the standard 3D and Compute percentages but are reserved for high-priority tasks that need immediate processing to maintain performance and stability.

items.name: WMI Load AMD Radeon(TM) Graphics D3D High Priority Compute
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' and Parent='/gpu-amd/0' and Name='D3D High Priority Compute'"]
items.description: D3D High Priority 3D/Compute: These are similar to the standard 3D and Compute percentages but are reserved for high-priority tasks that need immediate processing to maintain performance and stability.

items.name: WMI Load AMD Radeon(TM) Graphics D3D Security 1
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' and Parent='/gpu-amd/0' and Name='D3D Security 1'"]
items.description: D3D Security 1, D3D Timer 0: These are specialized tasks reserved for secure processing and specific timing operations, although they're less commonly detailed in standard GPU monitoring tools.

items.name: WMI Load AMD Radeon(TM) Graphics D3D Timer 0
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' and Parent='/gpu-amd/0' and Name='D3D Timer 0'"]
items.description: D3D Security 1, D3D Timer 0: These are specialized tasks reserved for secure processing and specific timing operations, although they're less commonly detailed in standard GPU monitoring tools.

items.name: WMI Load AMD Radeon(TM) Graphics D3D True Audio 0
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' and Parent='/gpu-amd/0' and Name='D3D True Audio 0'"]
items.description: D3D True Audio 0, 1: Indicates the load on the GPU's dedicated audio processing paths, used for handling complex audio computations in real-time.

items.name: WMI Load AMD Radeon(TM) Graphics D3D True Audio 1
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' and Parent='/gpu-amd/0' and Name='D3D True Audio 1'"]
items.description: D3D True Audio 0, 1: Indicates the load on the GPU's dedicated audio processing paths, used for handling complex audio computations in real-time.

items.name: WMI Load AMD Radeon(TM) Graphics D3D Video Codec 0
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' and Parent='/gpu-amd/0' and Name='D3D Video Codec 0'"]
items.description: D3D Video Codec 0, D3D Video Decode 1, D3D Video JPEG: These metrics show the GPU's utilization for video processing tasks such as decoding and encoding video streams, including specific formats like JPEG sequences.

items.name: WMI Load AMD Radeon(TM) Graphics D3D Video Decode 1
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' and Parent='/gpu-amd/0' and Name='D3D Video Decode 1'"]
items.description: D3D Video Codec 0, D3D Video Decode 1, D3D Video JPEG: These metrics show the GPU's utilization for video processing tasks such as decoding and encoding video streams, including specific formats like JPEG sequences.

items.name: WMI Load AMD Radeon(TM) Graphics D3D Video JPEG
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Load' and Parent='/gpu-amd/0' and Name='D3D Video JPEG'"]
items.description: D3D Video Codec 0, D3D Video Decode 1, D3D Video JPEG: These metrics show the GPU's utilization for video processing tasks such as decoding and encoding video streams, including specific formats like JPEG sequences.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H Power Core #1 (SMU)
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Power' and Name='Core #1 (SMU)'"]
items.description: Core #X (SMU): Power usage of each individual CPU core.

items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Power' and Name='Core #2 (SMU)'"]
items.description: Core #X (SMU): Power usage of each individual CPU core.

items.description: Core #X (SMU): Power usage of each individual CPU core.

items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Power' and Name='Core #4 (SMU)'"]
items.description: Core #X (SMU): Power usage of each individual CPU core.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H Power Core #5 (SMU)
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Power' and Name='Core #5 (SMU)'"]
items.description: Core #X (SMU): Power usage of each individual CPU core.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H Power Core #6 (SMU)
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Power' and Name='Core #6 (SMU)'"]
items.description: Core #X (SMU): Power usage of each individual CPU core.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H Power Core #7 (SMU)
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Power' and Name='Core #7 (SMU)'"]
items.description: Core #X (SMU): Power usage of each individual CPU core.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H Power Core #8 (SMU)
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Power' and Name='Core #8 (SMU)'"]
items.description: Core #X (SMU): Power usage of each individual CPU core.

items.name: WMI Power NVIDIA  GeForce RTX 3070 Ti Laptop GPU Package
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Power' AND name='GPU Package'"]
items.description: GPU Package: The total power consumption of the entire GPU package, which includes the core, memory, and auxiliary components. The values given show power usage at different states, from idle to high performance.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H Power Package
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Power' and Name='Package'"]
items.description: Package: The total power consumption of the CPU.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H Temp Core (tctl/Tdie)
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Temperature' and Name='Core (Tctl/Tdie)'"]
items.description: Core (Tctl/Tdie): Temperature of the CPU cores. Tctl is the control temperature reported by the thermal sensor, Tdie is the actual die temperature.

triggers.expression: last(/Zabbix LibreHardwareMonitor For WIndows Agent Lenovo/wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Temperature' and Name='Core (Tctl/Tdie)'"],#10)>=160
triggers.recovery_expression: last(/Zabbix LibreHardwareMonitor For WIndows Agent Lenovo/wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Temperature' and Name='Core (Tctl/Tdie)'"],#5)<160
triggers.name: WMI: AMD Ryzen 7 6800H CPU Core Package Above 160 F
triggers.description: Sends alert of AMD Processor is over 160 F

items.name: WMI Temp NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti Laptop GPU Core
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Temperature' AND name='GPU Core'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for GPU Core Temp in °F.

items.name: WMI Temp NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti Laptop GPU Hot Spot
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Temperature' AND name='GPU Hot Spot'"]
items.description: Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor for GPU Hot Spot Temp in °F.

items.name: WMI Throughput NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti Labtop GPU PCIe Rx
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Throughput' AND Parent='/gpu-nvidia/0' AND Name='GPU PCIe Rx'"]
items.description: GPU PCIe Rx/Tx: These metrics show the rate of data received by (Rx) and sent from (Tx) the GPU over the PCIe bus. High values can indicate intensive data transfers, essential for high-performance gaming or graphics applications.

items.name: WMI Throughput NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Ti Labtop GPU PCIe Tx
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Throughput' AND Parent='/gpu-nvidia/0' AND Name='GPU PCIe Tx'"]
items.description: GPU PCIe Rx/Tx: These metrics show the rate of data received by (Rx) and sent from (Tx) the GPU over the PCIe bus. High values can indicate intensive data transfers, essential for high-performance gaming or graphics applications.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H Core #1 VID Voltage
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Voltage' AND name='Core #1 VID'"]
items.description: Core #X VID: Voltage identification digital for each core shows the voltage level the CPU requests for stable operation under different loads.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H Core #5 VID Voltage
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Voltage' AND name='Core #5 VID'"]
items.description: Core #X VID: Voltage identification digital for each core shows the voltage level the CPU requests for stable operation under different loads.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H Core #6 VID Voltage

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H Core #8 VID Voltage
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Voltage' AND name='Core #8 VID'"]
items.description: Core #X VID: Voltage identification digital for each core shows the voltage level the CPU requests for stable operation under different loads.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H Core (SVI2 TFN) Voltage
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Voltage' and Name='Core (SVI2 TFN)'"]
items.description:
Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor on the AMD Ryzen CPU Core Voltage.

Core (SVI2 TFN) & SoC (SVI2 TFN): Voltage supplied to the CPU cores and System on Chip (SoC), respectively. This can indicate power delivery stability.

items.name: WMI AMD Ryzen 7 6800H SoC (SVI2 TFN) Voltage
items.key: wmi.get[Root\LibreHardwareMonitor,"SELECT Value FROM Sensor WHERE SensorType='Voltage' and Name='SoC (SVI2 TFN)'"]
items.description:
Collects data from LibreHardwareMonitor on the AMD Ryzen CPU Core Voltage.

Core (SVI2 TFN) & SoC (SVI2 TFN): Voltage supplied to the CPU cores and System on Chip (SoC), respectively. This can indicate power delivery stability.
